cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles southeast of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly moving northwest across the central and north-western Bahamas, forecast to skirt the east-central Florida coast Saturday, cross the peninsula into the northeastern Gulf of Mexico Sunday, then curve north-northeast toward southern Georgia and the coastal Carolinas early next week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet FL northward to the Volusia-Brevard County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coast from central Florida northward through southeastern Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Port could experience sustained winds 25–35 mph with a 25 % chance of reaching tropical-storm force (≥34 kt) Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast given current track and weak intensity.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain totaling 2–4 inches possible as the system passes inland to the southwest of the port early next week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave heights could hamper vessel movements and cargo handling.
